name: Spicy Black Bean Burgers (Instant Pot + Baked Option)

ingredients.notes: Cooked in Instant Pot with 2 cups water and 1 bay leaf, 30 min high pressure + 15-20 min natural release
Mixed with 2.5 tbsp water and rested 10 minutes (or use 1 egg)

instructions: Cook black beans in the Instant Pot: Add beans, 2 cups water, and a bay leaf. Cook on high pressure for 30 minutes, then natural release for 15–20 minutes. Drain and let beans dry well.
Mix ground flaxseed with water and set aside to thicken for 10 minutes.
Sauté chopped onion and garlic in a skillet over medium heat until soft, about 3–5 minutes. Let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, mash the cooked beans with a fork or potato masher, leaving some chunks for texture.
Add sautéed onions/garlic, chipotle pepper, tomato paste, soy sauce, flax egg, oats, walnuts (if using), and spices. Mix thoroughly.
Form into 4 patties. If mixture is soft, chill in the fridge for 15–30 minutes to help firm up.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment or foil and lightly grease.
Place patties on the sheet, lightly brush or spray tops with oil. Bake for 20–25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
For extra crisp, broil 1–2 minutes per side at the end. Serve on toasted buns with desired toppings.
